review: Service was great. Our server was very attentive and sweet. However the food is okay. The burger was cold and the milkshake was watery. Our brownie dessert tasted like the kind you get from a box and heat it up except ours wasn't a tad bit warm.
Unbelievably bad slooooow service by far the  Worst I have ever been to.... Numerous tables around us also had extremely slow poor service
LOVE LOVE THIS PLACE . I go here for every occasion and the staff is always nice and very very outgoing.

We went tonight around 8pm, 4 adults 3 kids. They seated us promptly but there we sat. I don't understand why, when a restaurant is not at all busy it takes forever to get service, then when we do get it our food comes out barely warm, if warm, and our server disappears after telling us they are going to bring fries for one of the kids who asked for them. They were apologetic when they returned and did realized they forgot the fries, and then brought some posts haste. I just don't get it. It's not that difficult, especially when it's not busy. If it were a Friday or Saturday night with a big crowd, then maybe I could see a delay in service and perhaps some warm food but there might have been 10 tables or less...on top of that, when I got my burger, the peppercorn burger, it looked sickened compared to the photoshopped image on the menu, not tasty looking all. I've been here before and had pretty good service and food, so this visit will not deter me from returning in the future in hopes of a better experience. When they are good, they are good!  Tbl 60 check 80977

Solid menu with a good lineup of beef burgers.  Chicken offerings are very good as well. All come with bottomless fries.  Pretty consistent quality, preparation and presentation are a plus. For a change of pace, try one of their salads.  Local brews on tap.  Outdoor patio right up against Washington/Stark Street A little pricey, but overall, a pleasant dining experience with decent service and a good drink selection.

I always tend to get "togo" here and it's always been awesome. By the time I finish my drink at the bar, my food is up and I'm ready to go. Tasty, nice atmosphere, especially in this area of mall 205...shudder...thanks for being cool red robin

I'm still not a fan of Red Robin and this experience was no more impressive than any other visit. I went here on the request of my daughter. There wasn't a huge wait to be seated, but the wait for service was longer than it should have been. The two tables on either side of us arrived later, but were served and left sooner than our table. We all had different servers.  Our server was friendly and personable, but the dishes were dirty. We had to send back the silverware and water glasses because there was food stuck to to them.  The food wasn't to my liking. I had the quac burger, but the quac was some frozen concoction of something like coleslaw only green. We had a chips & salsa appetizer which was about a half cup of chips that were soggy in the middle and burnt on the edges. The salsa was the consistency of having been run through a blender and tasted like it had been mixed with spaghetti sauce.  They don't offer up drink or french fry refills anymore, and didn't offer to let us order desert either.
Waited 30 minutes to be seated 45 more to get subpar food. The manager needs his ass  whooped for allowing this location to be ran like this.

This was my second time at Red Robin (first time was in Southern California ---- yearssssssssss ago)! And now I remember why!!!!  A small burger with limited fries (in a small metal ring) will set you back over $10.00. Super sweet bottomless Freckled Lemonade (WHATEVER BOTTOMLESS MEANS TO THEM???), will set you back almost $5.00 and they ain't very attentive about refilling it because it happened just once. No, water was served either. Our waiter pulled a desk tablet right out of my hand, while I was looking through the menu (I still gave him 15% just because.........).  I'm pretty sure this is my last time at Red Robin. Com'on Red Robin gets your act together. :(

Red robin is always a good go-to! With the prices of fast food these days, you may as well get Res Robin to go! We live within walking distance so we do this on occasion. Each time we've enjoyed food here, whether to go or not, the service is always stellar and the food always fresh and cooked as ordered.  We've never had a wrong to go order also, which is great!

"If you think bad, bad is what you get"   And I did and it was... So, my amazing Supervisor was like  "oh hey, I want  take you guys out for lunch"  "let's go to Red Robin"! So, we were like....ok  (But I cringed) at the thought..see, I've been here before and it was not good.  We all ordered burgers, since it's burger week or something like that..  How do you want your burger cooked ?? they asked. Here is the breakdown; Burger #1 ~  Med...it came well done Burger #2 ~  Med well...it came Med Rare* Burger #3~   Well done...came back Med Burger #4~    Med well....hey got one.  My coworker was not going to eat her Med Rare* burger and I didn't blame her for calling them over to notify the server of this. He just said  oh ok I'll take it back and fix it..we waited... And Waited..and finally we just gave up. finally we just flagged the server and told him it was  now a to go order.... No apology, nothing....it totally was the focus of Our conversation,  instead of talking about life And office stuff we festered over this..... I personally hate leaving one star reviews, but This place made it real easy...., nothing went right. Wrong orders...Bad service...No Apology. I want to say they can do better, but it won't happen on my dime.

Update, haven't been to red Robin in a long time, but boy was it enjoyable. Came here on a very nice day, in a lift car, and boy was my hamburger, nice and fresh. Service was very friendly and attentive at all times, and I was asked if I needed more fries, or another refill on my drink. After I ate, I went outside to red robins nice little handicapped parking lot, and hailed my last Lyft taxi, to head home. That is one of the most beautiful things about red Robin, is that it's not just the food, and friendly service, but it's also because of the fact that they have a handicapped parking spot, and that was perfect for Lyft to park into to pick me up. So, if you have a handicapped, you are definitely in luck if you use Lyft taxi cab service to pick you up, The handicapped parking lot is so large, that lift will just pull right in, and park without a hitch. So, I just have to say, it was a very wonderful visit today here at red Robin, despite it being close to the 90s outside. Very fresh food, and awesome friendly service all around.

I love this restaurant but.... when paying for my to go order with their machine it automatically figures out your tip. It told me that a bill of $14.77 should give a tip of 20%(OK I normally do 15 but today I did 20) would be four dollars and some change. It should be $2.96.

Our server, Ashley, ruined this place for my friends and I. She spent 15 minutes of her time chatting it up with a couple of guys behind us while she forgot our sauce and my friends side. My friend waited to eat her food while she just stood there and chatted. We even rang the call server button and we still waited an extra 10 minutes. Worst service. I was just baffled that she prioritized chatting for 20 minutes over actually helping us. We'll be going to the Gresham location for now on.

The service at this location was pretty poor. It took a while for my group of 3 to get out food, and they didn't bring us a basket of fries during the wait, which I usually get offered at the Clackamas location. Upon getting our food my friend was mad because we didn't have a single napkin on our table. We had to ask for both some fries during our wait, as well as some napkins.

Sometime in the last 3 months, this restaurant has had a major renovation.  What an improvement!  The bar area is now clearly signed as 21+ (no kids yay!) and is partially screened off instead of being completely exposed to the waiting area like before.  There is a fantastic decorative chandelier made of brown, green, and clear glass bottles.  The plain wooden stools have been replaced by comfy leather and wood stools.  I think they added more TV's?  It's just much more cozy, sophisticated, and chic than before. The main section of the dining area has been rearranged and the furnishings upgraded.  I only walked through on my way to the bathroom so don't recall too many details but it looks great. I'm sorry to say, though, that the bathrooms were NOT renovated.  The women's bathroom continues to display the primary yellow, blue, red, and white dingy tiles and dilapidated feeling.  Too bad, really.  The bathrooms were always dodgy but now, compared to the rest of the public area, it's a stark blemish.  I hope the bathrooms are next on the rejuvenation list. Food was awesome.  Service was excellent.  I LOVE how I can customize all the meals on the Red Robin website and see nutritional info based on my customizations.  Extremely helpful for a gal on a diet like myself.  We'll be back!

Food was alright. However, the service was terrible. After being seated, we were not even acknowledged until fifteen minutes later. Next time we go to red robin, we'll definitely be going to a different location.

Update: My husband wanted to try again, even though this place is dead to me now. Once again, during regular business hours, no response to our call for a takeout order.  ---------- The service here has always been hit-or-miss, but today the staff decided to go on strike, or a work slowdown, or something. We called 4 times to place an order for pickup, and finally my husband went to just order there. He waited, along with a dozen other would-be patrons, and no one ever appeared to seat or serve anyone. Class act, guys. FWIW, Five Guys off Johnson Creek was delighted to get us some amazing burgers double-quick.

The food was good but it just took forever to get anything. My sons bottomless fries were out so we ordered some more. Then our drinks were out. When the fries came we ordered refills. While waiting for drinks we ordered dessert on their new electronic device on the table. We got our dessert pretty quickly. Asked about those refills waitress said they were coming. Dessert is almost gone. Still waiting on drinks.....

Red Robin is well known for their specialty hamburgers with all sorts of extra ingredients embellishing the burger itself.  I'm somewhat of a "purist" when it comes to burgers (and I also didn't want to pay over ten dollars!) so I ordered a more ordinary (and less expensive) "Red's Tavern Double", which includes just traditional things such as two burger patties, American cheese, lettuce, and tomato.  Red's Tavern Double costs a reasonable $6.99 and also includes "bottomless fries". . .a great deal.   OK, the burger was exactly what I wanted, was fire grilled, and was very good.  However, even better (as far as I'm concerned) is that I could substitute "bottomless steamed broccoli" in place of the fries.  I have an obsession with broccoli since it is a "superfood", so the thought of eating all the broccoli I want was really appealing.  Well, now I know that Red Robin is the place to go for a good burger and to load up on Vitamin A.

Shout out to our charming and attentive server Analy (according to the receipt) tonight for keeping her cool and giving us great service even when it was slammed.  The holiday season brings large groups (Calling ahead will expedite seating if you have a big group!)  and red robbin's staff managed the rush seamlessly this evening.  Thanks again for a great meal and excellent service. :)

We went to this restaurant location to celebrate my grandson's birthday. We picked Red Robin because my wife likes that they sing to the birthday person and give them a small individual sized Sundae. This location was the closest to the auto headlight repair shop we had dropped my son's car at. We asked for a table for 5 and did not have to wait very long to be seated.  Our drink order was taken quickly and served expeditiously. We ordered the large onion ring tower as an appetizer and that was out fairly fast too. Once our food orders were taken the waiter had refills out to us. Our meals came out except they forgot our two special dipping sauces for the fries. We informed the waiter but he also forgot and only brought them out after I order more fries.

Well..Red Robin is our family "go to in a pinch" reliable restaurant for a good food, good service, and decent prices.  The burgers are consistently well prepared as requested and their "bottomless" steak fries are very yummy.  The kids' meals are pretty good too (as our youngest kids tell us), because you get unlimited Mac and Cheese and Salad servings, and they make a killer milkshake too.  I almost always order the Chicken Teriyaki Burger (comes with tomato, Swiss cheese, and pineapple) and is also consistently cooked to perfection, juicy and flavorful.   The side salad is fresh and crisp too.  Overall, this is great place to go for lunch or dinner.  Enjoy!

I had a bad experience here once before, but I figured two years is enough time to weed out the bad people that worked there. Apparently I was wrong. Out wait person was ok, but kept forgetting things like the rest of the fries we ordered (3 kids meals split into 2, but only 5 fries!), the paper wrap my husband ordered for his messy burger, a refill on WATER! Not the best service. Then we get home, I fell asleep on the couch, woke up feeling nauseous. 5 minutes later the chicken sandwich came up either  because it decided it didn't like my stomach or it wasn't done all the way. Either way, now I feel like crap. Thank you for year another bad experience Red Robin. Definitely won't be returning here again!

Well we ordered on a phone call with a woman right now from about 5:55-6:00 and she was just very friendly and knew the menu and all the right suggestions to make . She really made our ordering food a pleasant and quick thing. I will call this location again for my family all because of that service ! Thank you ! ( if her employer want to reward her and I forgot her name she ordered two pub and cheeses in our order and some pretzel bites to stand out . She really should be commended

Service was great, especially compared to other red robins that I have been to.  We were seated fast, and everyone was friendly.  The food was mediocre, but it wasn't terrible.  We had onion rings, fried pickles and I had a Banzai burger.  I don't know if I'd order these things again, but I didn't send it back to the kitchen...  The lava cake was probably the best part of the meal.   If I had to base this review on the food alone, I would have rated it a 3, but the service will bring me back, if I am looking for a quick burger and am in the area.  I am also taking the class into account, when rating.  I don't consider these to be "gourmet burgers," even though Red Robin claims that they are.

Arrived to celebrate a birthday and we're not greeted at the door. (Police were standing in the entry... may have been part of the problem) We eventually made our way to the table in the back of the dinning area. (First visit since the rebranding/renovation. Not impressed. Much darker in the entire place.) We had 10 seats to full and a highchair for a toddler. The standard setup looked like it would fit 10 people perfectly and the highchair would sit between the parents. As we started to sit down, the first of two hostesses comes over and asks us to step back and they can add another table for more seating... no one asked for more seats.  After playing musical chairs and moving two tables, we were seated and separated by the giant L shape table we were just crafted. At this point, I was frustrated I couldn't sit near by kids, and they couldn't sit across from their uncle and aunt. We were seated a total of 30 seconds before we were asked if we would want drinks. Greatest moment of the entire service... Brace yourself, it's downhill from here. The kind waitress we had assigned to our table seemed to be overwhelmed by the conundrum created by the tables. After a few minutes of walking through the gauntlet of chairs she was able to get our orders and was gone. We saw her once more when our drinks were delivered and that was it until food was ready.  During the meal, my wife and I had our bottomless fries refilled once, and only one of our lemonades was ever refilled. (I'm still quite parched) My daughter asked for a cheese pizza meal and received pepperoni (and no one responded when we questioned it). Most of the food was good, but far smaller portions than other nearby restaurants for the same price. Overall the food wasn't worth the troubles we had just to be seated. Appreciate the waitress and her effort to make things better but definitely not a visit I want to remember.  Perhaps a one-off bad experience, but this makes two in a row for my family... last time we were here was prior to renovations so let that weigh in on the quality for revisits.

I ordered Postmates from here and I will never do that again from this location! The food was border line frozen when it got here, there was a god damn hair in my food and they only gave me 6 fucking fries, don't say you have botmless fries and only give someone six fries that where frozen! This place is horrible and will never recommend it to anyone!
This is our local RR and reliable fallback for a good meal, familiar menu, and friendly service.  Glad we have this one in the area!

It's been a while since I've been to a Red Robin, and today I was there to take some students to celebrate. There were six of us and we sat at a round table with a waiter who had a hilarious and dry sense of humor. He fake pressured us all to get milkshakes and yet we enjoyed getting them.  And I will personally say that if you are going to get a milkshake here, you should get the salted caramel one. It was so perfect in the mixture of sweet and salty.  I had the whiskey River barbecue burger with lettuce instead of a bun and while I could not finish it, it still is a classic favorite. Their barbecue sauce is so complementary to the burger. The staff are friendly and the place is relaxing and really there was nothing that prevented us from having a delightful lunch.

I was here the other day i ordered a burger and my bread was soggy didn't get asked for more bottomless fries i was disappointed and my girls food the chicken was barely warm almost cooked i feel like the food was just sitting at the window for awhile i know this only happens when food sits because i work at a restaurant so food is not coming out at reasonable time  i will not be coming to this location again

Ordered from GrubHub and asked specifically for no cheese on a salad and no ketchup on a burger.   The salad contained cheese and the burger had ketchup. The onion rings were...bleah. I know this is a chain burger joint and I really shouldn't expect much, but seriously?   Not a mistake I'm going to make again.

What a horrible dining experience.  Fries were cold. Our waiter never came back around after we asked for more fries. Never brought our cheese dipping sauce but charged us twice for them. Never brought my sons soda and when he finally stopped by the table fifteen minutes after we had gotten our food he just brought water. We told him again what he had forgotten but we were pretty much done with dinner at this point and he still never brought our requests. I have been to other locations that seem better but this one Is the worst.  Even the wait staffs appearance was borderline sloppy. If you have a choice drive on by and go to a better managed location.

Ok peeps... Times have changed at Red Robin. :-)  No more waiting for the waiter or waitress to come with the check.   You can now check out the menu, play games for $1.99, check your Red Robin rewards card, pay your bill unless you're paying cash, leave a tip and print a receipt at your table using the new Ziosks they have placed on the tables.   Pretty convenient it is especially if you are in a hurry but I will say I think we may be losing that personal touch.  :-(  Maybe the next thing will be food runners.  You will order and pay by Ziosk and food runners  or robots will just bring the food.  :-)  The food at Red Robin is decent for a chain and today was no different.  Ordered the California chicken sand and fries.  Service was good and my waitress was very friendly. :-)  Love the guac on my chicken.  :-) Enjoy! 2016-5

Who is the Bone Head that ruined the Patio?!  We like the Red Robin Chain. Each member of our family has their favorite burger. We're addicted to the fry sauce. Our server today Jeffery was fantabulous. Very attentive and took good care of us. Our drinks were not allowed to run dry nor were our bottomless fries. Red Robin Restaurants however; are loud. Because of the decor, the din of other diners makes it hard to hear your dining companions talk. We found the perfect solution with the Mall 205 location's secluded patio. The patio sits right off the bar and was a true hidden gem. It HAD full grown shrubbery that let the breeze through yet gave ample shade for the hottest day. The shrubbery provided privacy from the traffic on Washington street and the Mall 205 parking lot. Imagine our horror today to find the patio devoid of any shade or privacy. Yeah, that's exactly what we want, to see and hear all the utility trailers from Home Depot clanking past us while we eat. This is a good example if "If it ain't broke don't fix it". Had the idiot who came up with this idea asked staff who had been there awhile, I bet they would have advised not to mess with it. But, as with most organizations, management rarely consults with the front line workers who actually do the work. Not having a secluded, shaded, summer time patio is A DEAL BREAKER Red Robin. We won't be back any time soon. You'll get us back when some privacy screening and shade are back in place. You'll get more stars too.

Waited 15 min to get seated.  Seated and no one came to take our orders.   Waited like 10 min and finally asked someone to help us.  Ordered a turkey burger, terrible.  Tasted like a hot dog.   Food here s so expensive and bland.  No taste.  Disappointed at $60 later.

If I could give this place negative five stars, I would.  What should of been a simple online to-go order turned into one of the most frustrating experiences I've ever had at a restaurant. In the past, there was a sign near the bar for To Go orders at this Red Robin. Now there is a separate table out front. The problem is nobody seems to be staffing this table. Eventually the hostess came over and asked if I'd been helped, and I said no. She went to get someone from the back who then came out and asked for my name on the order. She went and looked and said that no order came in. This was the start of what would be a very long back and forth I had with multiple employees. I was asked if I could of sent it somewhere else and I said no, I made the online order for this location, with a set pickup time, 100% sure of that. At that point the employee asked what I had ordered and I told her, and she wrote it down, saying they would have to place it manually. After doing this, however, she asked me if I was SURE that I sent the order to the Red Robin on Washington Street. I replied that I'm looking at the order on my phone, and it specifically says the Mall 205 Red Robin. At this point I was getting annoyed and I said I can show you the email on my phone or give you the order number, and she barked no at me and went to go pawn me off on another employee Another woman came out this time who was a little nicer, but once again I was asked if I submitted the order to another location, and I gave the same response.  At this point I asked to speak to whoever the manager is, because apparently I'm not doing a good enough job communicating. Finally, a guy in a suit came out who introduced himself as an assistant manager.  Once again I was asked if I was sure if I submitted the order here, and by this time I was pissed. I came here with a small 2 year old child in tow to quickly pick up a caesar wrap and a kids chicken sticks, and here I am being bombarded with questions on am I sure I placed the order correctly, all the while trying to be a decent parent and entertain a 2 year old. I once again offered to show the email with my order information. The assistant manager went into the back and apparently produced an email they received showing there was an error with my order.  He said the issue was that the error email came in 15 minutes before the pick up time, that they aren't in the back sitting around monitoring emails all the time. I replied neither am I, and I'd already left my house by the time any email would of arrived to me. I was told its a "technical error" that happens about once a month, that its not really their fault, and it just sucks that it happened to me. I was asked if I still wanted to order my food. At this point my jaw dropped because an employee had come out and written down the order manually, and I assumed my order would already be going. I mentioned that and he made a comment about not knowing if I really wanted the food, so it hadn't been started. I'm chasing around a fussy two year old and have been here a half hour now, so yeah, I probably do want it. I told him that was ridiculous and I want the name of his manager. I was given a card with a name on it that said assistant general manager but that they aren't in until tomorrow, told me he would take 15% off my order, then slipped away to the back before I could even respond.  I don't know if this person is actually his manager, but it wouldn't surprise me if he tried to dump me on his weekday equivalent. This has very little to do with money to me, as it was just a simple $15 order. The staff could of apologized for the error, offer to take half off the total, make it a priority and whip the order out in 10 minutes. In the end, it took well over an hour to get what should of been a very simple order. I had a two year old child that was running around with poopy pants because it took so long, that wanted no part of waiting around. There was no apology, no taking responsibility by the staff, even worse having multiple employees trying to blame me for the mistake. Most of the employees I interacted with showed little to no professionalism what-so-ever, and its clear this place has gone downhill even faster than I thought. I've never had staff attack me like this and try to blame me for something that was clearly an error on the Red Robin end. I've dined in here before at this location and seen mistakes happen, but the staff at least made an effort to make it right in the past. This time, however, that didn't occur. After all was said and done, I got a pathetic looking caesar wrap that barely had any meat in it, and two of the smallest orders of fries I've ever seen from here which were already cold by the time I even got in the car. I'll be escalating this up as far as I can up the ladder until I reach someone who actually understands customer service, and that this location has some serious problems that need to be looked at and dealt with.

Came here and got the big siracha burger. Our server whitney was the best. She was on top of her game. Checked up on us every couple minutes, she even made sure our water and fries were never empty. Her service gave this place a 5/5 for me

I really like the food so we seem to go back even though we never get good service. This last time was it for us, the service is so bad its almost laughable. We will probably still go to Red Robin just stick to the Clackamas location.

I'm not a huge fan of Red Robin trying to be a 'fancy' burger place. I liked their whole, basket/burger/fries ambience. Their prices have gone up, quality and quantity has gone down, and everytime I go there their service is less than great. Now they give you a small tin O of fries (which are still bottomless) but try getting extra fries takes about the time it takes to finish your whole meal.  My horrible experiences are greater than the positive ones, but I still love the taste of their food so ill definitely keep going back. This last time our waiter (Cam) was very nice and helpful. My friend ordered the wrong thing (pointed but said 2 different thing) and he offered to take it back and fix it, then came back and APOLOGIZED for OUR mistake! Which was really cool of him to do since it wasn't his fault at all #hegetsatip

My friend took me here. I never eat here on my own but they have a certain charm. Not a big fan of their burger but I am a fan of Blue Cheese. So I had the Blue Ribbon Burger with Extra Cheese. Not bad. But I also wont be going out of my way to eat here. The place gets busy and is a little loud.  Be careful when an employee is near as they don't really look where they are going.  Lucky for me, I work in a restaurant and know how to dodge, duck, dive and dodge.

Burger was greasy and they forgot onions. The patty was bland without taste. Server Connor ran off before I finished my sentence. Stingy on napkins. Slow to refill the decent fries.   I ordered a premium burger and got a McDonalds taste. I've had much better for half the price.  Parking is backwards.  Want a good burger? Go to Five Guys.
I went to red robin on July 17th with a friend of mine we had the best meal And great service on a busy Friday night
Order fish n chips and a bloody margarita Margarita was not made properly to spicy and not good tasting. Took 45 mins for food to come and my fries and shrimp was cold and moist. Never again.

I generally order for the whole office, usually only takes 15 minutes for the whole order which is awesome! Parking is very convenient. When I get there, they always remember my name. Great place to eat! Thanks for the good service.

Things have changed since I was hear last . tried the Tavern Burger and last hear had the Royal Red Robin was unable to put my hand around the burger but the Tavern Burger ( burger )has shrunk to cut costs and bottom fries where in basket.

Okay I don't know what's going on with RR anymore. They are trying to be something different. Their bacon is the microwaved kind with no flavor. The fries weren't very hot and haven't been the last couple times. I don't know why I even come. I only go if friends with no taste want to come. The service was alright. But not stellar by any means.

Adequate but not fabulous... Our waiter was nice but seemed very overwhelmed... Got a chicken sandwich with a gluten free bun. THE BUN WAS NOT GOOD!!!! Sooooo dry and hard I couldn't even eat it... I asked for no mayo cause it's gross and there was mayo... Fries were yummy of course and so was the margarita, but if you're going to offer a gluten free bun, it should be good enough to serve as a substitution.. Not make it an additional price for a terrible bun... I mean hockey puck.

Worst red robin experience ever. Got takeout, our order was missing an item so went back to ask for it. They rushed it and it was poorly made they offered extra fries, but never gave them to us. We got our (cold after waiting) food home to find that they had only given us 5 fries in our boxes. Since when is red robin SO stingy on fries?!

I got the California chicken burger with bacon which is my usual & it's always good. Love the sweet potatoes fries, but I wish they gave you bigger portions so you didn't have to wait so long for a refill. Staff is usually pretty good too.

We enjoy Red Robin but our experience at this location was less than impressive.  While the food and service were good the place is in disrepair.  The women's restroom had born soap dispensers broken with only one of them functioning.  Toilet paper roll was hung from hook on stall door because holder was broken.  Paper towel holder also broken.    These seem like cheap and easy fixes.  Are they that cheap they can't put a few bucks into the space?  Especially when hygiene should be a high priority in a restaurant

I'm a true fan of red robin always!  But this location was a little bit lacking in the service department.  I ordered a baja wrap, which a whiles back in college, was a wrap.  However, the waiter gave me a BLT burger, which I sent back.  Then a baja sandwich came out and by then I was fed up.  I simply went with it, but I was not satisfied and definitely didn't get what I appetite wanted.  However, maybe it was a miscommunication on my part and they dont make that wrap anymore, so I'm not blaming the waiter.  Simply he could have handled it with less attitude. Otherwise, I love red robin!

My first time at a Red Robin and I have to say it was damn good. We ordered a Chophouse and a Burnin' Love and they were both very tasty. The fries are good. I'm not usually a fan of the "steak" cut but these were perfectly cooked, hot and fresh tasting. There is a little menu of dipping sauces that cost 50 cents each and we had the roasted garlic and the green chile varieties. Nothing beats ketchup, but these were a nice break when you're devouring bottomless fries. Our server was attentive and above average for a fast-casual place. We heard the server behind us relentlessly trying to upsell his customers - he obviously took all the corporate training very seriously- but ours was always there when needed and never intrusive and got an above average tip for it.  Sit in the bar for a pleasant screaming kid - free area. There seemed to be a lot of screaming kids coming in and we were glad they offered us the respite of the bar to eat in. Take that, McDonalds!  Of course if you have screaming kids you will feel very welcome here. Lunch for 2 - 2 burgers and 1 drink ( I just had water) and a couple of dipping sauces was a little over 25.00 bucks which seems like a solid value. I'll definitely be going back.

I haven't been to Red Robin in two years because I was disappointed in the quality of service and food I got. Thanks for not surprising me Red Robin! Once again, the food was terrible and the service sucked. Now they have remodeled the place and these stupid lil computers are on each table. Thanks for ruining family conversation Red Robin! One of my kids bought a game I didn't even know they were selling games !!!! So beware of the extra expense on your bill! The quality of the food has gone wayyyy down I thought I had stepped into a Denny's. The cheesy fries with bacon came out with two American cheese slices semi melted just topped on the fries the bacon they forgot and then just brought out separately. Seriously??? Who puts American cheese slices on cheesy fries???? Can you say middle school cafeteria?!  The Chicken salads that were ordered were also poor quality, lettuce not fresh, old fried bits of jalapeño warmed up, gross chicken breast that had a weird watery texture. Nope! Spent too much money for crap food and bad service . I didn't even get into that piece of the review but suffice to say that on a night where the restaurant is Empty you expect attention to detail and speediness. Red Robin failed on so many levels!!! Never going back to this over priced 1 star restaurant ! I could get better food at a Fast Food joint.

Food was good but they don't bring out fries when u order ur meal anymore she said it just changed so customers would order appetizers so it's not really bottomless. I also had to wait for long periods of time for refills and more fries, they didn't bring napkins. Service was slow not happy

Complete disaster. Stopped by three days prior to holding a large group gathering to warn them. They do not take reservations, but said they appreciated the heads up. We called at 1:30 the day of to remind them again of our group of 18 coming in a an hour. We all arrived and let them know we were all present. We didn't get seated for over an hour and they were not busy. They had plenty of space. Finally got seated and our waitress was fabulous, but the manager was no help. Put a huge damper on my daughter's birthday. She not once helped us. Never going back to this location.

Kind of your typical chain burger restaurant.  The salads are quite yummy tho. The burgers satisfy that grease craving you have and they deliver fries in a lovely little bucket so you don't feel like you're going to over eat them.  I give a 3 star though because the service just sucks. They take a while to notice you're at the door, and we'd have to wait nearly 20 minutes in between each time trying to catch our waitress. Decent alcohol selections tho. So all in all if you want a typial slacky chain restaurant this is the place for you!

If I could give negative stars, I would. My family actually ate at this Red Robin multiple times every single week without incident up until tonight. I don't see us EVER returning after the DISGUSTING way that we were treated by the management. We were sitting at our table awaiting our food when the child from the table next to us pounded on our table with both fists.  We were surprised and not happy as we have a 4 and 6 year old who are not permitted to behave that way.  The mother of the child began making comments about how WE HAD A PROBLEM until we finally asked her to stop.  It was impossible to ignore as their table was only about 14-16 inches away from ours.  I asked this woman at least 6 times to just quit talking to me and she called me an obscene name in front of my two small children (as well as her own.)  Both my partner and I said "Are you kidding?  We have kids sitting here! Just stop talking to us.  Leave us alone!" This is where Red Robin management really had a chance to shine.  Roger, apparently the manager on duty, approached our tables and without even pausing to find out what was going on told us we need to immediately stop talking.  Yes, just stop talking.  After I was verbally assaulted, called names and harassed in their restaurant, I had every reason to be upset.  My 6 yr old was in tears and visibly very distressed.  Upon his approach, I tried to explain to Roger what had transpired and he actually SNEERED and said, "Good for you. Now stop talking." Obviously we decided to leave.  We were basically attacked at our table then the manager comes over and joins in on it??? To add insult to injury, some other person who knew the offensive couple rushed after me as I left and actually grabbed my arm and hissed insults at me while I held my4 year old.  Thanks Red Robin.  I feel so safe in your restaurant after being both verbally and physically attacked.  If Roger wasn't such a dismissive, contemptuous individual I wouldn't blame Red Robin at all, but the response to what happened to me as a regular, frequent patron and HUMAN BEING is beyond unacceptable and ridiculous.  This manager has no business dealing with the public and should be immediately dismissed.BOOOOOOO, Red Robin. If you have kids/family, value your safety and/or expect to be treated with respect as a paying customer DO NOT VISIT THIS RED ROBIN. TWO THUMBS DOWN. UPDATE: I stand by my review and have been contacted by Red Robin with an offer of a gc...But disturbingly I have also been contacted multiple times by the bully who chased me into the lobby.  I received several abusive messages before I blocked him.  It is actually very scary as well as sad.  I am entitled to share my experience here on yelp as I have done.

My wife went to this Red Robin with a group of co-workers. The service was very slow and she got her meal long before some of her co-workers. She had already finished her meal by the time her boss was served his, a bowl of soup. As he finished his soup, he found a band-aid in the bottom of the bowl. This experience has understandably put my wife off of restaurants.

Good lord, what happened to this place? I expected that good food and service would come with the remodel but I think not. My crew and I came in here on the 18th of January to celebrate a birthday. We sat in the bar area and ordered burgers, chili, and fish n chips. Now, I NEVER experienced bad service or food here before so this visit shocked me, especially on a night where it was someone's birthday. Burgers were bland, the fish tasted odd, the tartar sauce tasted like ranch, even the mouth watering steak fries here tasted funny. The server we had also seemed like he had a bad night, since he never smiled. And why did you get rid of those booths in the bar? I actually liked being able to kick back and relax while drinking.  All in all, I would probably not come back to this place again.
Our waitress was so forgiving in the fact that we had to wait for the rest of our party to arrive. She would check in just to make sure we didn't anything while we waited.
It's a guilty pleasure of mine and a great place for a test date. If a girl stays with you after a trip to Dead Robin she's probably pretty legit. Or white trash.

Nasty, nasty, nasty. I'll pass over the fact that they still trot out the tired old corporate lie "we can't do a rare burger because it's against the law," but their food is uniformly underwhelming. Actually, I won't pass over it. At least say something like "our corporate lawyers told us it's safer to sell crap for food so that's what we do." Just blatantly lying to my face isn't going to impress me at all. But the food itself isn't good. It's passable, in the way that there are calories in it (an embarrassment of them actually), and there is a component of taste, but it's way overpowered by the wave of grease and equally greasy staff. It's essentially an overpriced McDonalds; I'll just go there in the future when I want crappy junk food.

My dad and I went in to the mall 205 location on 12/6/15 around 4 pm. first off it wasn't busy, yet no one was at the front to seat us for about 5 min. then when the waitress finally took our order it took 10 min to bring our sodas, that were watered down. then the food came out and i very clearly said "no mayo" iv never eaten it so i always say that. well there was some on there. so they took it back, while my dad let his food get cold waiting for mine to come out again he notused that his plate was disgustingly dirty with a greasy build up. he just asked that they put his food on a clean plate. they came out and just wiped off the edges. my food then came back out and AGAIN there was mayo! so i got a different waiter and he took it back once more. at this time we also haven't had a refill since we've been there. finally my burger came out correct COLD but no mayo. no manager was there at all. we have gone to the clackmas location and never had a problem. but the mall 205 was the worst experiences ever.

I usually LOVE Red Robin, and sweet potato fries are a particular weakness. Needless to say, we come here for lunch about once a week, and I've ordered the sp fries at least 6 times since Christmas. At first they were delicious, but as they've gotten more popular, they can't serve them hot enough for my taste, even when I ask them to. They just aren't any good when they're cold! I haven't given up on them yet, but i've started eating a salad now and then.
Great food for a decent price. Service is super slow, but it is a busy place.

I really like their plain Red Robin cheeseburger done medium. I have them hold the mayo so it's not so messy and it's a great burger. The fries are delicious too and always hot. It's noisy, but the food is worth it. We have always had good servers too
Food is  great .but waiting time is to long I  cant wait for salat a  40 minuts .

Red Robin is all right at times, not really impressed me over the years.  The food is okay in the restaurant portion of the place, but the drinks in the bar are great. I guess to numb, they do have a decent alcohol session.

when i first walked into red robin with my friend i was kind of overwhelmed by all of the stuff. i mean every single inch of every single wall is covered in kitsch. it looks as though the united states of america glugged a quart of boone's farm (strawberry) and vomited americana dreams all over the walls. second thing that happened was the woman in front of me with the very bright smile said "would you like to high five ___?" i looked to her left and there was a stuffed bird person with it's wing up and humongous hand ready for a high five. friends i was so excited and overwhelmed that i fairly shrieked HELL YES I WANT TO GIVE HIM A HIGH FIVE and totally went for it like i was the rambo of high fives.* for some reason that tickled our host who was giggling so hard that he had to cover his face demurely with one of the over sized plastic menus. he could barely speak to me as he showed my lovely date and me our seats and just kind of gigglingly waved our seats to us. the date and i ordered one of those huge towering onion ring things. boy oh boy was it impressive! the girl next to us with her salad looked on as we two fat girls ate every single ring off of that tower with great gusto. do i not know how to show a lady a good time? i ask you. the elegant older woman next to us to a shine to us and i know she said some cool things but i must admit that i was so entranced with my lovely date and the lovely whiskey river burger that i could hardly hear her words. that is until we noticed that the giant red robin bird was being led around to hug children (who frankly looked scared) because clearly the bird can't see in that huge head. as the bird made its way around the place i became obsessed with the skinny legs under the big bird body, those spandex legs were supposed to be tight but nay, they were saggy and did nothing for his sweet bird ass. the sweet older dame next to us in a moment of brilliance suggested i grab some bird ass or at least spank it!  lady, i am not your spanking robot. keep your kinks to yourself. *i like never high five.

There's a Home Depot around the corner. My husband and I just moved into a new house so long story short, we have eaten here twice in three days. The food is good. There I said it. It's a chain but I find it above the likes of Chili's, Applebees, etc. The food is a little pricier ($10-13 entrees) by a couple dollars than those places, but I feel like the quality is better too. The staff at this location really impressed us. Yes, they are going through their required motions of making small talk when they take you to the table, but energetic staff that are on their game beat surly apathetic servers any day. Our food came out in a very timely manner both times. My glass never got to empty without a refill. The steakfries are bottomless but I could never manage to polish off my first round. But they are delicious. Our burgers were cooked to order and the adornments were fresh and delicious. The hamburger meat isn't gourmet but I thought it was tasty.  The bathroom is super clean and has a TV in it, ha! The only weird thing about this Red Robin is that the front entrance faces the road but all the parking is behind and away to the side. Good food and excellent service gets you 5 stars, I don't care if you are a chain.
Between the screaming children and the overpriced crap for food the whole experience was truly soul crushing.

Red Robin has not really impressed me over the years.  Their food is sub par at best.  It can get  crowded and noisy, especially with the teenage crowd.  I do admit they do have a decent alcohol session to numb the pain.  Last time I went, I was so disappointed with their "spicy" burger.  It was not spicy at all, they should have just called it the mild and bland burger instead.  Service is sketchy too, it can be good when it wants to be.  If I want great burgers, I go to Huber's or McMennamins.

I've never had an issue with this place, except the last time I was there. At the front they asked if we wanted to sit in this little cluster of booths that were at the front. My boyfriend and I shrugged and followed her to our seats. We got weird stares from people sitting around us, but I just assumed they were weird. About 3 minutes later, this guy who has his pants half way down his butt comes to our table and asks if we are 21. (For the record we are 20, turning 21 in about a month) "well, no" I said. "WHOOAA YOU CAN'T SIT HERE THEN. THIS AREA IS FOR ADULTS" My boyfriend and I proceeded to stare at him. He yelled the whole conversation and made me feel kinda stupid. After we got re-seated in the "non-adult" section. Our waitress was M.I.A. It took her about 20 minutes to take our order and another 20 to give us our check.  We will probably go back cause I am a sucker for their salads, but this occasion really pissed me off.

my wife and i went tonight and had one of the best mushroom burgers that i have ever had, my wife had the avocado supreme salad and after finishing it wanted to order it again and bring it home lol, very good service while we sat at the bar, cause there was a 15 minute wait for the dining room cause it was extremely busy

When my ex-gf said she wanted to go to Red Robin, I was a little unoptimistic.  Felt like a high school date or something.  But because I love to avoid arguements and drama, we decided to hit up RR. We were seated very quickly and served by a highly enthusiastic waiter.  He must have worked at Chotchkies (think Office Space) in the past, because he started off really hyper annoying.  Eventually he came back down to earth after a little bit, which was good. The meal I got was delicious.  The burger was huge and there weren't too many fries in the basket to really feel guilty about not finishing. Overall, these guys served us a quality meal in record time for a Saturday night.  The final cost was a little bit more than I'd like to pay, but thats the joys of going to restaurants.
I've had better, fresher tasting food from the frozen section of Safeway.  If you love absolutely mediocre food at the highest possible price, you'll love it!
Yummy huge burgers with bottomless fries, fun big drinks alcoholic and non. Neat decor,  a few tv's playing sports,friendly staff

I've eaten at Red Robin many times (I have young children who love it!).  I usually eat at the Vancouver locations and have always been pleased with my food and service.   At the spur of the moment, I decided to take my kids to lunch at the one near the old Mall 205.  There are a few things that bugged me...   first of all, when I was seated I noticed a dirty napkin on the floor next to my table that SEVERAL servers walked past and never picked up.  I eventually picked it up after about 15 minutes.   I ordered a hamburger and my kids (age 4) shared a kids' meal.  When our bill arrived, we were charged $1.79 for an extra kids drink.  I politely said to the server, "has there been some kind of policy change?  I have been to Red Robin 100's of times (other locations) and my kids have always been able to share a kids meal with no extra charge."  She said she would talk to the manager.   A couple minutes later a man walked up and said he was the manager.  I explained the same.  He said there was nothing he could do and he would only allow them to share a drink if it was the same drink.  **keep in mind that the menu states that it is a "bottomless" drink**     What?!?? He would NOT remove the $1.79 charge. I was very disappointed.  At the very least, if he is a real stickler for rules, I would have expected him to remove the charge and say that next time he will have to charge extra.  Obviously, I would not have ordered the extra cup of milk if I knew I would be charged, so he could cut some slack THIS time.  After all, what is his cost for that cup of milk?    The customer is always right, right?  Guess not.  I will not ever return to this store. Rude Manager

Food is good, but the service suuuuuuuucks. Last Sunday afternoon, my husband, son and I met my mother at the Red Robin at Mall 205 for an early dinner. It was about 5pm when we arrived and the place wasn't busy. There were 8-10 other parties there: not crowded. I repeat: not crowded. My mother arrived first, was seated at a smallish 4-top, let the server know there would three others joining her and ordered an iced tea. She sat reviewing her menu and enjoying her drink, with three other menus arranged on the table. Despite that subtle hint, she said the server TWICE came to take her dinner order. She told her, "I'm waiting for other people, thanks," and gestured to the menus. Duh.  When we arrived (about 10 minutes after Mom had arrived) and joined my mother, we were set upon almost immediately (I had literally just slung my purse onto the back of my chair when the server asked if I was ready to order). I was in the middle of greeting my mom and hadn't even picked up the menu yet. Jesus. We placed our order -- two burgers, a bowl of soup, a chicken wrap, drinks and two appetizers (barbecued wings and artichoke dip). From where he was sitting, my husband could see the pass and noted, about 15 minutes after ordering, that he could see our dinners (who else would order a bowl of soup on a 98° day?!). No sign of the apps and no sign of our server.  While our food was stagnating under the heat lamps, our apps arrived. The server set them down with apologies for their lateness, clattering chips across the tabletop. He left TWO napkins and scuttled away. Barbecued wings. FOUR people. TWO napkins.  Before we could even TOUCH the apps (I shit you not -- not TEN seconds had elapsed between one server leaving and the other arriving), our dinners were presented. The waitress scootched the artichoke dip away from my mother to make room for her soup. My mother, fully annoyed, said, "The appetizers JUST arrived. Couldn't you have allowed for a little time for us to enjoy them?" The waitress apologized and said, "Would you like me to take your dinners away until you're done with the appetizers?" My mother said no, we'd like our dinner to be served hot. Just dumb. We requested more napkins and got a healthy stack for the table.  I quickly filled up on artichoke dip and didn't have room for my burger. I left it, completely whole with NOT ONE BITE from it, in its basket in front of me. Leftovers for lunch on Monday, sweet! As soon as I could find our server and get a box...  We enjoyed our dinner -- the food is tasty as always, but the service was lackluster. When I needed a box for my burger, she was nowhere to be found. My son needed silverware to cut his burger in half. The staff were clustered in a corner nearby giggling and chatting; we had to flag one down to ask for a knife. We had to flag her down again to refill my husband's ice water. When my son wanted more fries, we gave up trying to flag someone down.  After eating for fifteen minutes, a server came to bus the table. He took away the appetizer dishes and reached for my mother's soup bowl when she -- honest to God -- had a spoonful of soup ascending to her mouth. She shook her head, annoyed, and he began to scoop up my burger. MY WHOLE, UNEATEN BURGER. I said, "Hey, no. I need a box for that." He returned with a small box (the kind you might fit a cupcake in) and I had to mash my larger burger into it. He then took the rest of our dishes away.  We then sat for -- I COUNTED -- 8 minutes. Our server finally came by to ask how everything was. My mother explained about the mix-up with the apps, the lack of napkins, the absentee service. No explanations, no excuses, no apologies. The server asked if we'd like refills on our drinks. We were very obviously ready to go (purses in laps, debit card in hand, hint, hint) and we had to ask for the check.  The server went to her station, printed the invoice and slipped it into the portfolio. She left it on the table and started to leave. My mother said, "Can I just pay this now?" The server seemed annoyed (mind you, it was no busier than when we'd arrived) and took our payment. My mom asked us, "Was I supposed to take that to the front?" The server's attitude made her -- the customer -- feel like she'd done something wrong. I assured her, no, they're SUPPOSED to process the payments.  We arrived in GOOD moods and left in BAD moods. Never a good sign. The food again was good. The service has never been great at the Mall 205 location, but now it's positively abysmal. No thanks, Red Robin.  Sorry this is so long. I'm still irritated.

Went to red robins on Washington it was 1230 in the afternoon we sat by the window it was so dusty and dirty I feel like I wanted to walk out the bathroom was dirty no seat protectors The waiter didn't even ask what my husband Burger should be and it was way overcooked he ordered a mai tai it had the wrong ingredients in it he couldn't even finish it this place needs a total makeover are the staff needs to be retrained this place needs to be inspected

Horrible service and cold food! We waited for 40min for our food while others around that arrived after us were served food. When asked about the status of our food the waitress was snippy and said they were busy... Not busy. We waited for another 10min and the kids food came 3 Mac and cheese, 7min later two soups (1 wrong) and a cold chicken sandwich. The waitress never checked on us. Clam chowder was luke warm. My Husband didn't even eat chicken sandwich it was so cold. Requested a mgr. who was not very apologetic. Never even saw him making rounds in the restaurant prior to asking for him. Prob one of the worst food experience ever. Waitress should prob find an new job.
One of our favorite places. Now endless broccoli my son was so happy! They have healthy options I love that! The servers are always so friendly the food good. Very nice family place to eat.

They have a new plate set up for the burgers.  No longer do they have the basket full of French fries they now have them in a silver round container that allows the fries to stand up right on the place.  Much less clutter and easier to eat in my opinion.  I am always pleased when I go here for a burger.  The chopp house burger is my go to.  With steak sauce and onion straws it's always a winner.  I can never seem to be able to get that second serving of fries I'm always full after eating my first serving along with my burger.  The waiter I had this time was very attentive and never let our drinks run dry.

I am on a limited carb diet and was concerned when the family decided to go to a burger joint. Much to my surprise.....I got a burger with no bun. Yay.  I also had the onion rings with the batter taken off. Delicious All in all not bad.

If you haven't been to Red Robin lately (I hadn't) & are interested in salads (I never was before) the Avo-Cobb-o Salad was $10 @ curbside pickup and tasted awesome for two lunches and a dinner. Avocado, chicken, bacon, egg, tomato, romaine, blue cheese crumbles, sick sick sick olives, your choice of dressing and focaccia.

By far the best Red Robin I have been to in a long time. They are the staple of what made tis franchise great. I wish more Red Robins would follow this guideline of great food perfectly cooked and taste delicious.  Their beer on was great and not old like most others and also the customer service was awesome.
Open another one in the area... This one gets sooo busy that the staff can't handle it so we just don't go... you would get enough business... just open one near 122nd and halsey.

Man, we are done with Red Robin. This was the last location with ok service. However, the last 2 times its been abysmal. First time, we had a rude waitress who rarely checked in with us and just had an attitude. She then did the entire check-out FOR me on the little tablet, even though I've used them many times before and even told her that. She still did it for me, and I believe it was so I couldn't do the survey at the end. Just rude. Second time, I actually had to get up to find someone to help us. The table next to us apparently had a different server, who wouldn't even glance at us. I pushed the "call server" button, which no one really cares about I guess. Talked with the hostess, who was very sweet and took our drink order after waiting for 15 mins. She found our waiter, yet 10 mins later he STILL hadn't stopped by our table. Hostess came by again, apologized and found him. (This place was not busy, I should point out). the guy finally comes over and apologizes like it's not a big deal. Only reason we stayed was because it was my daughters birthday. We didn't even get a chance to let anyone know that, though, because our waiter wasn't around long enough to be told. We won't be going to any Red Robin locations again. It's one of my daughters favorites, but the service is horrible and no one seems to care. So they've lost my business.
The bottomless fries are great, the strawberry lemonade is one of my favorites, and the burgers are decent. Not bad for a last minute meal, especially if you have a large group or a lot of kids.

Service has always been iffy  at this location.  This time three employees walked by me and my friend like we were invisible before a fourth person seated us.  The server was slow, never asked if we wanted any more sides (So much for "bottomless"!) and basically acted like we were an interruption to her very special life.  None of the food was hot, fries slightly soggy and stale.  Next time I want a veggie burger I will go to Elmer's a block away.

A group of old friends decided to meet here for lunch.  We were seated by a nice hostess and when everyone arrived, hung out for a while.  Granted, it was noon and we were happy to be talking but how long does one have to wait?  When our server finally arrived, she was pleasant and friendly.  However, the food was mediocre at best.  My clam chowder was barely warm, although the taste was pretty good.  The mixed salad seemed to be mostly cucumbers.  I noticed my friends left a fair bit of food behind.  If you have another choice, go somewhere else!

I stopped in because I was staying at a hotel and it was close by. Normally I wouldn't review a chain restaurant, but this was an unexpectedly good experience. The staff was great and my bacon cheeseburger was perfect. After seeing all the commercials for it on TV I was anticipating Red Robin to be a fast food restaurant. Casual dining yes, but not fast food. It was more costly than I was anticipating, but it was reasonably priced. It's got a fairly limited menu focusing on burgers and sandwiches, but the full bar was a plus. Like I said  previously, I was pleasantly surprised.
Waited forever to even get drinks, while i watched other costumers who just arrived get seated and order before us, no drinks no, hi how are guys doing.
Always a great place with great service. My only critique is that, for a place that specializes in burgers, they should ask how you want it cooked

Service was HORRIBLE and SLOW, and it was not even that busy. It took a very long time for the food to come out, and my 4 kids (six years and under) were not easy to keep occupied while we waited. Also, Although we ordered everything GLUTEN FREE, I ended up getting very sick immediately after eating, so I know there was a cross-contamination issue. I would NOT go to this Red Robin location again.
I went into Red Robin today for lunch and it was very busy, our server Alexis was very nice and on her game! She was great. The soup and fries I got were very good!
Elizabeth was an entertaining and attentive server. The burger was magnificent - totally perfect and delicious. Bottomless fries are always a plus, and the iced tea was delicious. We will be back!

I regularly, and happily, eat at two different Red Robins on Portland's westside. Recently, I've been to the Washington Street location three times--enough to know that my experience wasn't a fluke. Each time the restaurant was nearly empty, yet it was ten minutes before I saw a server and another 30 minutes to get my food. On the third--and what will be the last--visit, I had limited time and let the host know when he seated me. Ten minutes later, with no acknowledgement from the server in my section, I tracked down another server who was kind and helpful. However, it was still an astonishing 30 minutes before my meal--a plain chicken breast with no sides--arrived. On each visit I  had to ask for silverware and a napkin after my food was served, something other reviewers have commented on. The sidewalk and landscaped area from the parking lot to the front door are littered with trash and literally hundreds of cigarette butts. Waiting to be seated in this family restaurant, along with a family with young children, we were all treated to a bedroom scene on the bar's TV monitor that was aimed at the reception area. My food was comparable to that at other Red Robin locations, but the management is clearly quite different. I definitely will not try a fourth time.
